2018-04-03 6:51 GMT+02:00 Ivanq <notifications@github.com>:

> @MarwaDF <https://github.com/MarwaDF> Oh, I see. You are using IDE.
>
> Could you please open Command Line (via WindowsKey+R, then cmd Enter),
> and try to execute some of the following commands;
>
> python
> python2
> py -2
>
> If you receive a Python prompt after running one of them (the prompt is
> >>>), type exit(); if you don't, try the next one. One of the commands
> should say ...Python 2....
>
> Now, if e.g. py -2 worked, you should create a script in ZeroNet/start.bat
> and type the following:
>
> py -2 start.py
>
> So you won't have to run ZeroNet via IDE (it won't help you at all,
> because ZeroNet is a server, and it is infinite, and ...well, will you ever
> need to debug it?..).
>
> —
